content:
• Thursday, August 16, 2012
  • DRYS

    More on DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q2 misses across the board despite a jump in total revenue....

    More on DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q2 misses across the board despite a jump in total revenue. Losses did narrow Y/Y, as revenue improved and vessel-impairment expenses weighed on year-ago results. But spot charter rates continue to hover at historic lows and asset values have dropped precipitously in the last two years, which continues to hurt both top and bottom line performance. Shares -4.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • COSI

    More on Cosi (NASDAQ:COSI): Q2 misses on all counts on an overall decline in total sales. Net...

    More on Cosi (NASDAQ:COSI): Q2 misses on all counts on an overall decline in total sales. Net profit improved, but overall sales declined due primarily to locations closed during and subsequent to the 2011 second quarter as well as to a 1.3% decrease in comparable restaurant sales. Shares -5.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 PM
  • MFCB

    MFC Industrial (MIL) says it's extending the expiry time of its offer for all of the common...

    MFC Industrial (MIL) says it's extending the expiry time of its offer for all of the common shares of Compton Petroleum to 5:00 p.m. (NYSE:PDT) on August 27 while it awaits requisite contsents. Shares +4.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:14 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) falls another 3% in after hours trading, adding to its earlier 7.5% decline...

    Molycorp (MCP) falls another 3% in after hours trading, adding to its earlier 7.5% decline during the regular session following the company's offering announcement this morning. The rare-earth miner is in the process of modernizing and expanding its Mountain Pass facility in California.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • MRVL

    Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) guides on its FQ2 earnings call (webcast) for FQ3 revenue of $800M-$850M...

    Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) guides on its FQ2 earnings call (webcast) for FQ3 revenue of $800M-$850M and EPS of $0.22-$0.26, below a consensus of $914.9M and $0.31. MRVL -7.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • ARO

    More on Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q2 bottom line meets expectations, but top line revenue falls...

    More on Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q2 bottom line meets expectations, but top line revenue falls short. Overall sales were up slightly, but core basics business experienced significant pricing pressure due to the highly promotional and competitive retail environment. Comp-store sales fell 1%. The company also lowers Q3 earnings, now expecting its EPS to fall in a range of $0.25 to $0.30 per diluted share, below Street estimates of $0.38. Shares -7.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • DRYS

    DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q2 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $336.1M (+50% Y/Y) misses...

    DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q2 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $336.1M (+50% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 7 Comments
  • ARCC

    Ares Capital (NASDAQ:ARCC) announces a secondary of 19M shares, with an option for underwriters...

    Ares Capital (NASDAQ:ARCC) announces a secondary of 19M shares, with an option for underwriters to purchase another 2.85M. The secondary could add about 10% to the total current float of 222M shares. Shares -4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • OPLK

    Oplink Communications (NASDAQ:OPLK): FQ4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $44.2M (+1%...

    Oplink Communications (NASDAQ:OPLK): FQ4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $44.2M (+1% Y/Y) misses by $0.3M. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • MRVL

    More on Marvell's FQ2: The chipmaker blames its FQ2 miss on soft demand for storage and mobile...

    More on Marvell's FQ2: The chipmaker blames its FQ2 miss on soft demand for storage and mobile products - likely hard drive controllers and TD-SCDMA 3G baseband chips - which offset growing SSD, high-end hard drive controller, and Wi-Fi chip sales. $250M worth of shares were repurchased. Gross margin was 53.6%, down 90 bps Q/Q and 450 bps Y/Y. Earnings call at 4:45PM ET (webcast), guidance should be provided. MRVL -7.2% AH. Rival LSI-OLD -0.9%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • COSI

    Cosi (NASDAQ:COSI): Q2 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $26.3M (-2.2% Y/Y) misses by...

    Cosi (NASDAQ:COSI): Q2 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $26.3M (-2.2% Y/Y) misses by $1.7M. Shares -7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • VNET

    21Vianet (NASDAQ:VNET): Q2 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $57.4M (+58.6% Y/Y) misses...

    21Vianet (NASDAQ:VNET): Q2 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $57.4M (+58.6% Y/Y) misses by $0.7M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • ONXX

    Onyx (ONXX -3%) finished the day lower due to fears of dilution, says Deutsche. Concerns over a...

    Onyx (ONXX -3%) finished the day lower due to fears of dilution, says Deutsche. Concerns over a potential capital raise were brought to light after management refused to rule it out. However, Deutsche believes the issue has already been priced into the shares, but notes it could due debt financing. Regardless, the firm thinks the fundamentals remain strong and that Kyprolis can beat expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade Communications Systems (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ3 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $555M...

    Brocade Communications Systems (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ3 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $555M (+10% Y/Y) beats by $19M. Shares +5.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • AVGO

    Avago Technologies (NASDAQ:AVGO): FQ3 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $606M (+0.5% Y/Y)...

    Avago Technologies (NASDAQ:AVGO): FQ3 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $606M (+0.5% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • MRVL

    Marvell Technology Group (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q2 EPS of $0.24 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $816M misses...

    Marvell Technology Group (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q2 EPS of $0.24 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $816M misses by $36M. Shares -6.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q2 EPS of $0.00 in-line. Revenue of $485M (+4% Y/Y) misses by $5M....

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q2 EPS of $0.00 in-line. Revenue of $485M (+4% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -5.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • NTAP

    NetApp's (NTAP +3.8%) FQ1 report and FQ2 guidance helped companies with enterprise storage...

    NetApp's (NTAP +3.8%) FQ1 report and FQ2 guidance helped companies with enterprise storage exposure outperform. ELX +6.6%. QLGC +3.3%. BRCD +6%. QTM-OLD +6.3%. Deutsche (Buy) sees product catalysts such as Intel's Romley, new storage systems, and version 8.1 of NetApp's ONTAP OS driving shares higher, and Topeka is pleased FQ1 software/maintenance sales held up well. But Barclays thinks NetApp is still losing share to EMC (EMC +3.2%), which has carried out a big product refresh of its own. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • GPS

    Gap (NYSE:GPS): Q2 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $3.58B (+6% Y/Y) beats by $50M....

    Gap (NYSE:GPS): Q2 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $3.58B (+6% Y/Y) beats by $50M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT +14.4%) enjoys a bump from Meyer Burger's earnings release, which...

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT +14.4%) enjoys a bump from Meyer Burger's earnings release, which said it expects demand for its solar equipment to rise substantially in 2013. That's good news for GTAT, which gets half its business from solar, Piper Jaffray says; the other half involves sapphire, which could get a boost if it gains use as a replacement for glass in mobile devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 4 Comments
  • VASC

    Vascular Solutions (VASC -2%) says that on June 28, it received a subpoena from the U.S....

    Vascular Solutions (VASC -2%) says that on June 28, it received a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney’s Office in Texas under the Health Insurance Portability & Accountability Act requesting documents related to the company’s Vari-Lase products, particularly related to the use of its Vari-Lase Short Kit for the treatment of perforator veins. The request is related to a recently unsealed complaint filed in 2010 by a former sales employee, alleging kickbacks to physicians for using its product.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • WYNN

    Casino names Wynn Resorts (WYNN +4.1%), Las Vegas Sands (LVS +4.5%), MGM Resorts (MGM +1.8%) and...

    Casino names Wynn Resorts (WYNN +4.1%), Las Vegas Sands (LVS +4.5%), MGM Resorts (MGM +1.8%) and Melco Crown (MPEL +6.7%) rally on a China-on trade. Also pitching in to the good vibes is some of recent analysis on Macau gambling trends seeing the local typhoons that affected Hong Kong-to-Macau ferries as providing only a short-term speed bump that's now been cleared.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • RIG

    Barclays raises its stock price target and FY2013 earnings estimates for Transocean (RIG +4.4%)...

    Barclays raises its stock price target and FY2013 earnings estimates for Transocean (RIG +4.4%) following another positive fleet status report, highlighted by lower downtime expectations and numerous favorable extensions at higher dayrates. The firm says RIG is its top offshore driller due to substantial leverage to rising dayrates and compelling valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -3.5%) drops after the FDA orders a review of its Riata defibrillator...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ -3.5%) drops after the FDA orders a review of its Riata defibrillator leads. The agency recommends patients who have defibrillators with Riata leads should have x-rays or other imaging scans to check for abnormalities in the insulation surrounding the lead. STJ recalled the leads back in Nov. 2011; FDA says routine imaging may detect previously unrecognized abnormalities.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • GNC

    Deutsche Bank says the run in GNC Holdings (GNC -4.4%) is over, and the recent selling by...

    Deutsche Bank says the run in GNC Holdings (GNC -4.4%) is over, and the recent selling by insiders - including massive selling by its CEO - confirms it. The firm calls it a "broken stock," and downgrades the health-supplement retailer to Hold. It also cuts its price target by 16% to $42.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • GOLD

    A sale of African Barrick would be a natural starting point for Barrick Gold (ABX +3.9%) CEO...

    A sale of African Barrick would be a natural starting point for Barrick Gold (ABX +3.9%) CEO Jamie Sokalsky to keep his pledge to divest or defer assets which fail to generate target returns or impact long-term free cash flow. The African miner accounts for only 6%-7% of its parent’s annual output, producing ounces at well above the $550-$575 cost target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • SBAC

    SBA Communications (SBAC -2.2%) slips following a downgrade to Neutral from Citi. Peers Crown...

    SBA Communications (SBAC -2.2%) slips following a downgrade to Neutral from Citi. Peers Crown Castle (CCI -1.3%) and American Tower (AMT -0.7%) are also underperforming. AMT has seen a couple of downgrades recently on valuation concerns. All three cell tower owners have performed well in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • BBBY

    The home furnishings sector trades strong with Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +4.1%), Williams-Sonoma...

    The home furnishings sector trades strong with Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +4.1%), Williams-Sonoma (WSM +2.5%), and Ethan Allen (ETH +2.3%) all showing outsized gains on above-average volume. There isn't any dramatic news out today, but Home Depot's strong home furnishing sales in Q2 could be a behind-the-scenes factor.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • GERN

    Oncology treatment specialist Geron (GERN +14.3%) zooms higher, perhaps due to a positive...

    Oncology treatment specialist Geron (GERN +14.3%) zooms higher, perhaps due to a positive Seeking Alpha blog which recommends purchase for investors with room for some speculation in their portfolios. Geron's drugs "have the potential to change the way cancer is treated," the article says, citing six potential catalysts for GERN's stock over the next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • IBM

    IBM's (IBM +1.2%) acquisition of Texas Memory is a major validation of standalone flash memory...

    IBM's (IBM +1.2%) acquisition of Texas Memory is a major validation of standalone flash memory systems, thinks JPMorgan. Neither JPMorgan nor Benchmark see the deal as a major threat to Fusion-io (FIO +7.2%), which sells server flash modules. Benchmark thinks H-P (NYSE:HPQ) might buy FIO to better compete with IBM (ed: the company would be a big and expensive fish for H-P to swallow). OCZ (OCZ +7.9%), the subject of plenty of buyout rumors, is joining FIO in rallying on the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • IDIX

    With nearly 30% shaved off the top of Idenix (IDIX -29%) today on the back of the FDA's partial...

    With nearly 30% shaved off the top of Idenix (IDIX -29%) today on the back of the FDA's partial clinical hold placed on Phase 2 trials of its Hep c drug, Stifel Nicolaus steps in with a valuation upgrade. The firm raises the shares to Hold from Sell, noting that the hold is just temporary and likely to be resolved.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • OUTR

    Shares of Coinstar (CSTR +6.7%) gyrate up and down on volume that's already 3X normal activity....

    Shares of Coinstar (CSTR +6.7%) gyrate up and down on volume that's already 3X normal activity. There isn't too much meat for investors to chew on other than the New York Post report suggesting buyout talks with a P-E firm have advanced along with the interesting tidbit that an Amazon-Coinstar linkup would be a good fit.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • TCEHY

    Chinese Internet stocks are rallying, as pleasing earnings reports from Sina and...

    Chinese Internet stocks are rallying, as pleasing earnings reports from Sina and messaging/gaming giant Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) more than offset a miss from NetEase. BIDU +2.5%. SOHU +5.5%. GAME +4.9%. YOKU +5.9%. TUDO +5.5%. CYOU +2.1%. Tencent, which received a favorable WSJ write-up ahead of earnings, rose 6.4% in Hong Kong after reporting revenue of $1.65B (+56% Y/Y) and net income of $487M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 4 Comments
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +11%) has received both an upgrade to Buy from BofA, and a downgrade to Hold from...

    Sina (SINA +11%) has received both an upgrade to Buy from BofA, and a downgrade to Hold from Jefferies, after beating Q2 EPS estimates thanks to improving margins and slowing opex growth. Jefferies doesn't like the fact Sina's portal ad revenue grew only 1.5% Y/Y, thanks to macro conditions and share losses, and that Weibo enterprise account adds are missing targets. Also cautious is Goldman, which is worried Weibo ad sales are cannibalizing portal revenue. But with Sina well off its highs, bulls have the upper hand.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • BONT

    Shares of Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT -1.4%) rebound sharply following a horrendous reaction during...

    Shares of Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT -1.4%) rebound sharply following a horrendous reaction during the pre-open  - down 16% briefly at one point - on weak Q2 results. Losses widened due to debt-retirement charges and a continuing decline in revenue, although same-store sales managed to show slight improvement. The company also lowered its EPS guidance for fiscal 2012, and sees comparable store sales in a range of flat to up 1.25%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -1.2%) tilt lower again and are now down close to 14% since the...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -1.2%) tilt lower again and are now down close to 14% since the company announced a price cut for its lineup of Nooks. Rumors that the Microsoft Surface could sell for less than $200 surely can't be helping the mindset of investors on the name.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • GILD

    Deutsche Bank defends Gilead (GILD -1.6%) in the wake of the FDA's halting of Phase II clinical...

    Deutsche Bank defends Gilead (GILD -1.6%) in the wake of the FDA's halting of Phase II clinical trials for Idenix's drug IDX184 over safety concerns, saying it's a buying opportunity. The firm says the concern is with non-quanosine nukes, and notes Gilead's GS 7977 is a pyrimidine based nuke. It reiterates its Buy rating with a $68 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • NTES

    NetEase (NTES -13.1%) gets pummeled after missing Q2 estimates. The Chinese online game...

    NetEase (NTES -13.1%) gets pummeled after missing Q2 estimates. The Chinese online game developer blamed declining playing time for World of Warcraft, which NetEase jointly offers with Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI) in China. NetEase is hoping several new 2H game launches will help it rebound. Two bright spots: registered users for NetEase's microblogging services rose 48.8% Q/Q to 180M, and registered e-mail accounts reached 495M (there are probably a lot of duplicates).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • RRC

    Range Resources (RRC +2.2%) pops higher after Capital One points out attributes that could make...

    Range Resources (RRC +2.2%) pops higher after Capital One points out attributes that could make it a takeover target at as much as $100/share. The firm likes RRC's operational expertise and enormous drilling inventory, and believes RRC's Marcellus wells generate internal rates of return of 40%-75% while Upper Devonian assets could add significant additional value.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • CHL

    China Mobile (CHL -5.5%) slumps after its Q2 earnings miss estimates, and the company promises...

    China Mobile (CHL -5.5%) slumps after its Q2 earnings miss estimates, and the company promises to continue investing heavily in phone subsidies. Much like the U.S. mobile industry (previous), ramping sales of subsidized smartphones appear to be hurting the margins of Chinese carriers. Another challenge is the growing mobile adoption of instant messaging and social networking services such as Tencent QQ and Sina Weibo, which is impacting voice and text-messaging activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • DPZ

    UBS keeps its Outperform tag on Domino's (DPZ +1.9%), calling it a "compelling idea" on a...

    UBS keeps its Outperform tag on Domino's (DPZ +1.9%), calling it a "compelling idea" on a sum-of-the-parts breakdown. The exit of Trian Fund Management from the shareholder scene is also a positive, according to UBS. Earlier this week: (earnings, Goldman Sachs downgrades to Neutral from Buy)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • PACD

    Pacific Drilling (PACD -3.5%) reports a Q2 profit of $0.01/share vs. a $0.06/share loss in the...

    Pacific Drilling (PACD -3.5%) reports a Q2 profit of $0.01/share vs. a $0.06/share loss in the year-ago period, but shares sink as results fall short of expectations. Analysts had estimated EPS of $0.09 and revenues of $165M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • CJ

    C&J Energy (CJES +3%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $26 target price at Global Hunter,...

    C&J Energy (CJES +3%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $26 target price at Global Hunter, which believes it is "reasonably well positioned" to weather North American onshore market conditions in 2012-13. Term commitments and recent contract renewals from large E&P customers "speak to the legitimacy of CJES' growing franchise," the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • FB

    Well, that was quick: Facebook (FB -6.2%) has crashed through the $20 level on the day of its...

    Well, that was quick: Facebook (FB -6.2%) has crashed through the $20 level on the day of its first lockup expiration, and is near its post-IPO lows. Other recent consumer Internet IPOs are also feeling the pain: GRPN -6%. ZNGA -2.6%. YELP -1.4%. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 13 Comments
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (EA +7.1%) has given up half the premarket gains it saw on a report it's in...

    Electronic Arts (EA +7.1%) has given up half the premarket gains it saw on a report it's in early talks with P-E firms. Take-Two Interactive (TTWO +3.1%), which once spurned a bid from EA, is getting a lift, but EA archrival Activision (ATVI +0.4%) isn't so fortunate. It was only two weeks ago reports emerged that Vivendi is shelving plans to sell its 60% stake in Activision due to a lack of interest. Will EA's smaller market cap and greater mobile/social exposure be enough to produce a different outcome?

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • CSCO

    Cisco (CSCO +7.6%) jumps after beating estimates, hiking its dividend, and providing guidance...

    Cisco (CSCO +7.6%) jumps after beating estimates, hiking its dividend, and providing guidance and commentary that suggests its demand outlook (and perhaps the broader outlook for IT spending) is neither rosy nor terrible. At Cisco's current valuation, that's good enough for a strong rally. Goldman (Conviction Buy) thinks Cisco should no longer trade at a discount to other tech large-caps, but Needham (Hold) is less impressed. JNPR +2.7%. APKT +3.6%. FFIV +4.4%. RVBD +3.4%. ALU +4.8%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • PRGO

    More on Perrigo (PRGO -6%) FQ4: net profit +25% to $107.05M. Sales breakdown: Consumer...

    More on Perrigo (PRGO -6%) FQ4: net profit +25% to $107.05M. Sales breakdown: Consumer Healthcare +12%, Nutritionals +10%, Rx Pharmaceuticals +70%. FY 2013 guidance: adjusted EPS $5.30-$5.50 vs. $4.99 in the previous year and consensus of $5.42. Apart from the revenue miss, it's hard to see why the shares are getting battered.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • LB

    Limited Brands (LTD -2.4%) trades a bit lower after reporting Q2 results largely in-line with...

    Limited Brands (LTD -2.4%) trades a bit lower after reporting Q2 results largely in-line with the estimates of analysts. The company continues to ride the back of one of retail's best-kept secrets - the unflappable resiliency of Victoria's Secret - to greater heights. For 10 consecutive quarters Victoria's Secret has recorded comparable store sales gains in excess of 9% - an achievement rare, if not unmatched.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • ITW

    Illinois Tool Works (ITW +1.5%) plans to divest a 51% stake in its decorative surfaces segment,...

    Illinois Tool Works (ITW +1.5%) plans to divest a 51% stake in its decorative surfaces segment, consisting of Wilsonart and related international businesses, to a fund managed by Clayton, Dubilier & Rice. Through a combination of CD&R's $395M equity investment and borrowing by the new company, ITW will receive cash proceeds of ~$1.05B and retain a 49% interest in the business.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • ACHN

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +4.1%) rises and it could be for a couple of reasons. JMP...

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +4.1%) rises and it could be for a couple of reasons. JMP Securities upgrades the stock to "outperform" from "market perform," adding to Maxim Group's "buy" rating from June. Achillion, which is developing a hepatitis C drug, may also be benefiting from the FDA suspension of Idenix's rival treatment.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • IBM

    IBM is acquiring Texas Memory Systems (TMS), a maker of high-end flash memory hardware,...

    IBM is acquiring Texas Memory Systems (TMS), a maker of high-end flash memory hardware, for an undisclosed sum. TMS offers standalone systems that compete with Violin Memory and EMC-acquired XtremIO, and PCI-Express modules for servers that compete with solutions from Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO), STEC, and OCZ Technology (OCZ +2.9%). The deal is an attempt by IBM to invigorate a storage business that has been seeing declining sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • NYMT

    We're losing count of the number of mortgage REITs issuing secondary offerings. New York...

    We're losing count of the number of mortgage REITs issuing secondary offerings. New York Mortgage Trust (NASDAQ:NYMT) prices a 10M share secondary at $6.73 (yesterday's close $6.94). And the Fed is considering QE3? The world may run out of MBS soon. Shares -3.9% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are higher as Cisco's strong earnings report and new housing...

    Market preview: Stock futures are higher as Cisco's strong earnings report and new housing permits rising to their highest level in four years keep the juices flowing. The S&P benchmark is +0.2% and Cisco is +7.1%, while Sears is +2.5% following its results, although Wal-Mart falls 2.6% and Applied Materials 4% in the wake of their reports. EA is +11% on buyout speculation. Later: E-Commerce Retail Sales, Philly Fed Business Outlook
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) founder Richard Schulze sends another letter to the company's board...

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) founder Richard Schulze sends another letter to the company's board attempting to sway it that his takeover bid is the ubiquitous "win-win" scenario. Once again, Schulze asks to see Best Buy's books and to be granted permission to form an investor group that will comply with Minnesota law. Shares of BBY +1.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • BTH

    Premarket gainers: BTH +23%. VQ +17%. EA +10%. SINA +8%. CSTR +8%. OCZ +8%. CSCO +7%. SQNM +6%....

    Premarket gainers: BTH +23%. VQ +17%. EA +10%. SINA +8%. CSTR +8%. OCZ +8%. CSCO +7%. SQNM +6%. PETM +6%.
    Losers: IDIX -39%. MCP -8%. NTES -8%. A -7%. DLTR -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment

    Idenix (NASDAQ:IDIX) plunges 29% after the FDA places its IDX184 treatment for hepatitis C on a partial clinical hold following a "serious cardiac-related adverse event" involving a competitor drug.
